intro: Elytranthe hollrungii, commonly known as the Holmberg's elytranthe, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky areas. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in humid tropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less commonly cultivated species.
